pullRequest.body:
A point in a subset of a field is either a point of unique differentials, or isolated. In both cases, there is a definite value for the derivative of a map (its unique derivative in the former case, zero in the latter case). This means there is no choice involved, contrary to what happens in higher dimension. This remark means we can remove many `UniqueDiffWithinAt` assumptions in one-dimensional settings.

---

nodes.body: I'll be happy to review this PR, hence self-assigning. (Almost surely not before next week.) If somebody else feels inspired, be my guest.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20827~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

```suggestion
theorem zero_mem_tangentConeAt {s : Set E} {x : E} (hx : (𝓝[s \ {x}] x).NeBot) :
    0 ∈ tangentConeAt 𝕜 s x := by
```

All other lemmas about the tangent cone use `tangentCone` and not `tangentConeAt`. I agree it's strange, but I didn't want to depart from this convention in one single lemma. If we want to do the change, it should rather be in another single renaming PR.

Since the "feat" part of this PR is so well-delimited, would you mind splitting this PR into its "feat" and "chore" parts? (with the "chore" part depending on the "feat" part unless I've misunderstood)

pullRequest.title: feat: remove `UniqueDiffWithinAt` assumptions for one-dimensional derivative

nodes.body: I'll be happy to review this PR, hence self-assigning. (Almost surely not before next week.) If somebody else feels inspired, be my guest.
